channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Belarus Olympian given Polish visa after refusing 'forced' flight home
item.description: Olympian Krystina Timanovskaya says she was almost forced on a plane home after criticising coaches.

item.title: Turkey wildfires: Eight dead as blazes sweep through tourist resorts
item.description: Firefighters battle blazes in soaring temperatures as wildfires ravage resorts in southern Europe.

item.title: Turkey: People flee popular tourist spots to escape wildfires
item.description: Footage has emerged showing people fleeing the deadly fires which have engulfed parts of Turkey.

item.title: Giant panda twins born in French zoo
item.description: The event is described as "exceptional" by experts, as panda reproduction is notoriously difficult.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Serhiy Kulish eliminated after shooting at rival's target
item.description: Ukraine's Serhiy Kulish gets distracted by a wardrobe malfunction and shoots at his rival's target.

item.title: Sebastian Vettel disqualified from Hungarian Grand Prix after finishing second
item.description: Aston Martin's Sebastian Vettel is disqualified after finishing second in the Hungarian GP because of a fuel infringement.

item.title: Mitholz - the tranquil Swiss village facing a time bomb
item.description: More than 60 years after a deadly explosion ruined Mitholz, the village remains under threat.

item.title: BMX 360 backflip: The trick that secured Charlotte Worthington Team GB gold
item.description: A trick revered, unexpected and never done by a woman before - what is the backflip 360 pulled off by Charlotte Worthington?

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: An EU vaccine "passport" is being introduced, enabling holders to prove they have been jabbed.

item.title: Covid: Stalled Russian vaccines cause global anger
item.description: Deliveries of Russia's Sputnik V vaccine have fallen far below expectations.

item.title: The fungus and bacteria tackling plastic waste
item.description: Bacteria, fungus and enzymes can all digest plastic, but can they work at a useful commercial scale?

item.title: Extreme weather: What causes flash flooding?
item.description: Cities across the world are at risk of extreme rainfall overwhelming their streets

item.title: Turkey wildfires: People flee as blazes spread in Marmaris and Bodrum
item.description: Some neighbourhoods have been evacuated after gusts of wind spread the flames into residential areas.

item.title: Roma student: 'My only goal is to finish school'
item.description: How one school in Croatia is working to improve education opportunities for Roma children like Kristina.

item.title: Tips from the Netherlands on how to build a nation of cyclists
item.description: Some tips from the Dutch Cycling Embassy on how to make bikes the easiest and safest way to travel.

item.title: I survived Norway's worst terror attack
item.description: Lisa Husby recalls hiding in fear as far-right extremist Anders Breivik went on a killing spree in 2011.

item.title: Europe floods: 'I have an axe beside my bed'
item.description: Marion Wenzel showed the BBC around her flood-wrecked house in Ahrweiler, Germany.
